sentences.english: The"Madding Crowd"conceals the deep sense of illusion and absurdity.
sentences.chinese: 热闹喧嚣的场面下，蕴涵着浓重的虚幻感和荒诞意识。

sentences.english: Chico also was known for performing what was called the comedy of the absurd.
sentences.chinese: Chico也因为出演被叫做荒诞剧的剧目而出名。

sentences.english: "Waiting for Godot" has been regarded as a masterpiece of "Theatre of the Absurd".
sentences.chinese: 《等待戈多》一直被认为是荒诞派戏剧的代表作品。

sentences.english: A love triangle of the most grotesque kind.
sentences.chinese: 最荒诞不经的一种三角恋爱。

sentences.english: It is audacious, disruptive and preposterous on the face of it.
sentences.chinese: 表面看来，其胆大妄为，且颠覆常理，又荒诞可笑。

sentences.english: Going straight with this ridiculous world and stumble over this lonely world, finally they meet at the jail….
sentences.chinese: 在这个荒诞而寂寞的世界中一路前行，跌跌撞撞。

sentences.english: Modern magic fictions , seemingly absurd though, possess the essence of an intense reality-orientation.
sentences.chinese: 代魔幻小说虽看似荒诞但也有着很强的现实指归性。

sentences.english: The book read like a black comic burlesque.
sentences.chinese: 这本书读起来像部荒诞可笑的讽刺作品。

sentences.english: Paraphrase: Those who are blind to the absurd that is to be easily noticed propably are the civilized.
sentences.chinese: 对明显荒诞却又视而不见的，常是那些文明人。

sentences.english: The experience of "traveling north" to Harbin made Fengzhi realize the absurdity of the existence of human beings.
sentences.chinese: 哈尔滨的“北游”，使冯至认识到人类存在的荒诞性。

sentences.english: Uninhibited envy of any absurd dreams of living beings.
sentences.chinese: 任何荒诞不羁羡煞众生的幻梦。

sentences.english: On contemporary literature, Absurd Plays "Pan Jinlian" is a must-read works.
sentences.chinese: 上当代文学，荒诞剧《潘金莲》是必读作品。

sentences.english: His draftsmanship and technique display an uncanny mechanical reproduction that generates an uncanny reality.
sentences.chinese: 他用手工形成了一个比机械复制更加荒诞的现实。

sentences.english: A most simplistic schematic, grotesquely heightened by desires and wires.
sentences.chinese: 一个最简单的原理图，荒诞由欲望和电线提高。

sentences.english: The Theatre of the Absurd was a new school of drama appeared on the stage of the Western world after World War II.
sentences.chinese: 荒诞派戏剧是战后出现在欧洲舞台上的新的戏剧流派。

definition: silly talk or "mo lei tau" (Cantonese), genre of humor emerging from Hong Kong late in the 20th century
comical/funny/amusing/old pr. [gu3 ji1]/huaji, a form of comedy performance popular in Shanghai, Jiangsu and Zhejiang
absolutely ridiculous (idiom); preposterous/the height of folly
to rebel against orthodoxy/to depart from established practices
bizarre/paradoxical/a paradox (from Daoist classic Zhuangzi 莊子|庄子)
